verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a dry <S%H2720><s%> morsel <S%H6595><s%> with quietness, <S%H7962><s%> than a house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> of feasting <S%H2077><s%> with strife. <S%H7379><s%>

The refining pot <S%H4715><s%> is for silver, <S%H3701><s%> and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold, <S%H2091><s%> but Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> tests <S%H974><s%> the hearts. <S%H3826><s%>
An evildoer <S%H7489><s%> heeds <S%H7181><s%> wicked <S%H205><s%> lips. <S%H8193><s%> A liar <S%H8267><s%> gives ear <S%H238><s%> to a mischievous <S%H1942><s%> tongue. <S%H3956><s%>
Whoever mocks <S%H3932><s%> the poor <S%H7326><s%> reproaches <S%H2778><s%> his Maker. <S%H6213><s%> He who is glad <S%H8056><s%> at calamity <S%H343><s%> shall not be unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
Children <S%H1121><s%>'s children <S%H1121><s%> are the crown <S%H5850><s%> of old men; <S%H2205><s%> the glory <S%H8597><s%> of children <S%H1121><s%> are their parents. <S%H1><s%>
Arrogant <S%H3499><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> isn't <S%H5000><s%> fitting for a fool, <S%H5036><s%> much less do lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> fit a prince. <S%H5081><s%>
A bribe <S%H7810><s%> is a precious <S%H2580><s%> stone <S%H68><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of him who gives <S%H1167><s%> it; <S%H6437><s%> wherever he turns, he prospers. <S%H7919><s%>

He who covers <S%H3680><s%> an offense <S%H6588><s%> promotes <S%H1245><s%> love; <S%H160><s%> but he who repeats <S%H8138><s%> a matter <S%H1697><s%> separates <S%H6504><s%> best friends. <S%H441><s%>
A rebuke <S%H1606><s%> enters <S%H5181><s%> deeper into one <S%H995><s%> who has understanding than a hundred <S%H3967><s%> lashes <S%H5221><s%> into a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
An evil <S%H7451><s%> man seeks <S%H1245><s%> only rebellion; <S%H4805><s%> therefore a cruel <S%H394><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> shall be sent against him. <S%H7971><s%>
Let a bear <S%H1677><s%> robbed <S%H7909><s%> of her cubs meet <S%H6298><s%> a man, <S%H376><s%> rather than <S%H408><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> in his folly. <S%H200><s%>
Whoever rewards <S%H7725><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> for good, <S%H2896><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> shall not depart <S%H4185><s%> from his house. <S%H1004><s%>

The beginning <S%H7225><s%> of strife <S%H4066><s%> is like breaching <S%H6362><s%> a dam, <S%H4325><s%> therefore stop <S%H5203><s%> contention <S%H7379><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> quarreling breaks out. <S%H1566><s%>

He who justifies <S%H6663><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and he who condemns <S%H7561><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them alike are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>
Why is there money <S%H4242><s%> in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> to buy <S%H7069><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> since he has no understanding? <S%H3820><s%>
A friend <S%H7453><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> at all times; <S%H6256><s%> and a brother <S%H251><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> for adversity. <S%H6869><s%>

A man <S%H120><s%> void <S%H2638><s%> of understanding <S%H3820><s%> strikes <S%H8628><s%> hands, <S%H3709><s%> and becomes <S%H6148><s%> collateral <S%H6161><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>
He who loves <S%H157><s%> disobedience <S%H6588><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> strife. <S%H4683><s%> One who builds a high <S%H1361><s%> gate <S%H6607><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> destruction. <S%H7667><s%>

One who has a perverse <S%H6141><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> doesn't <S%H4672><s%> find prosperity, <S%H2896><s%> and one who has a deceitful <S%H2015><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> into trouble. <S%H7451><s%>
He who becomes the father <S%H3205><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> grieves. <S%H8424><s%> The father <S%H1><s%> of a fool <S%H5036><s%> has no joy. <S%H8055><s%>
A cheerful <S%H8056><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> makes good <S%H3190><s%> medicine, <S%H1456><s%> but a crushed <S%H5218><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> dries <S%H3001><s%> up the bones. <S%H1634><s%>
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man receives <S%H3947><s%> a bribe <S%H7810><s%> in secret, <S%H2436><s%> to pervert <S%H5186><s%> the ways <S%H734><s%> of justice. <S%H4941><s%>
Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is before the face of one who has understanding, <S%H6440><s%> but the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> wander to the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> brings grief <S%H3708><s%> to his father, <S%H1><s%> and bitterness <S%H4470><s%> to her who bore him. <S%H3205><s%>
Also to punish <S%H6064><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> is not good, <S%H2896><s%> nor to flog <S%H5221><s%> officials <S%H5081><s%> for their integrity. <S%H3476><s%>
He who spares <S%H2820><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> has <S%H3045><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%> He who is even <S%H3368><s%> tempered <S%H7307><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding. <S%H8394><s%>

Even a fool, <S%H191><s%> when he keeps silent, <S%H2790><s%> is counted <S%H2803><s%> wise. <S%H2450><s%> When he shuts <S%H331><s%> his lips, <S%H8193><s%> he is thought to be discerning. <S%H995><s%>
